According to the current knowledge , <extra_id_0> APOBEC3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays a role in the innate defence against pathogens like HIV-1 .

The latter has evolved a mechanism to counteract <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity by expressing the regulatory protein <extra_id_0> Vif <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 4 ) .

text: To investigate whether the overexpression of HIV-1 proteins also influences <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity , we either expressed HIV-1 <extra_id_0> Vif <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or the HIV-1 <extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein , the latter has been shown to activate different viral and cellular promoters ( 44 , 45 ) .

text: In addition , increasing amounts of the plasmid pNL4-3 , containing the full-length genome of HIV-1 , were transfected .
These constructs or the empty vector pcDNA3.1 were cotransfected with the 1025 bp construct into A3.01 T cells .

<extra_id_0> Luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> assays showed that the transcriptional activity of the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter was not significantly altered in the presence of <extra_id_0> Vif <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Tat <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or HIV-1NL4-3 ( Figure 4A ) , suggesting that HIV-1 is not modulating <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression on the transcriptional level .

text: It has been shown that the amount of <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in T cells is increased in response to mitogenic stimulation with phorbol ester ( 46-48 ) .
In addition , interferons have been described to upregulate <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in hepatocytes and macrophages ( 46 , 48 ) .

text: To investigate whether these stimuli interfere with <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity in T cells , we transfected A3.01 T cells with the 1025 bp promoter or the empty vector pGL3-Basic ( vector ) and treated the cells with phorbol ester ( TPA ) .

The <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> assay showed that the approximately15-fold increased transcriptional activity of the 1025 bp promoter relative to the empty vector was not further enhanced by TPA treatment ( Figure 4B ) , although the functional activity of TPA was confirmed by induction of the SV40 promoter - containing reporter plasmid pGL3 - Control ( data not shown ) .

text: Similarly , treatment of A3.01 T cells transfected with the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter deletion constructs with <extra_id_0> IFN-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> showed no effect ( Figure 4C ) .

Interestingly , a control plasmid ( pGL2-CVX ) containing twoIFN - responsive GAS ( gamma activated sequence ) elements upstream of the <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter gene was only induced by <extra_id_0> IFN-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in these cells ( Figure 4C ) .

Since two reports describe <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> upregulation by interferons in hepatocytes ( 47 , 48 ) , we additionally performed the experiment in the hepatic cell line HepG2 .

In line with these publications , we observed an induction of the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter by approximately 2-fold after <extra_id_0> IFN-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation ( Figure 4D ) with <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> being slightly more potent .

For both interferon types , induction of <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity was observed for all deletion constructs except for the 60 bp fragment , indicating that the responsible region is located within the 60 nt present in the 120 bp , but not in the 60 bp fragment .
